TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant married a certain PERSON
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE PERSON gave birth to their daughter PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , accusing the applicant of domestic violence , left the matrimonial home and moved to a safe house . In so doing she took their daughter with her .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON brought a civil action against the applicant in ORG ( PERSON ) seeking a divorce and custody of their daughter .

CARDINAL . After a hearing held in the presence of the parties and the representative of ORG ( NORP za socijalnu skrb ORG ) , on DATE ORG issued a decision whereby it regulated interim custody and access rights until the adoption of the final judgment on ORG ’s action . In particular , the court temporarily awarded custody to PERSON and granted the applicant access rights , allowing him to have contact with his daughter twice a month for TIME on the premises of the association Children First . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing at which the applicant did not oppose the divorce but asked the court to award him custody of his daughter . At the same hearing the court decided to refer the parties to mandatory mediation procedure , in accordance with the law . Specifically , the parties were referred to ORG . for the institution of this procedure .

CARDINAL . After completing the mediation procedure , on DATE the ORG submitted its report to the court suggesting that reconciliation of the parties was not possible and stating that they could not agree over custody of and contact with their daughter .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the court heard the parties and invited ORG to submit its recommendation as regards custody of the applicant ’s daughter and the ( extent of ) access rights of the non - custodial parent .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) quashed the first - instance decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and remitted the case to the first - instance court , holding that the latter had not provided sufficient reasons for its decision . In particular , ORG found that no reasons had been given for the interim award of custody to PERSON and saw no reason why the applicant ’s contact with his daughter had to be supervised .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG informed the court that it could not make the requested recommendation ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and that , in any event , because PERSON had changed the address , the matter was no longer in their competence but fell within the competence of ORG . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited ORG ( hereinafter : “ the local social welfare centre ” or “ the Centre ” ) to submit its recommendation as regards ( the extent of ) the applicant ’s access rights and the manner in which they should be exercised .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG recommended that the applicant exercise his access rights under supervision every DATE from TIME on the premises of another association . CARDINAL . At the hearing held on CARDINAL DATE the applicant proposed that he be awarded custody or , in the alternative , that he be granted access rights to be exercised without supervision in his home for TIME twice per week , DATE , and CARDINAL of all holidays .
CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the parties agreed that the applicant would have contact with his daughter twice a week for TIME under supervision .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the applicant proposed that his access rights be extended from TIME per week and also that he should have contact with his daughter every other DATE .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the applicant objected to the expert opinion in so far as it recommended awarding custody to ORG and supervised contact with his daughter . He also submitted an opinion obtained from another expert in psychology .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a fresh decision regulating interim custody and access rights . CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the court heard the expert in psychiatry who had prepared the aforementioned joint expert opinion of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the first - instance decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and remitted the case .

On DATE a multidisciplinary team of experts composed of a psychologist , a psychiatrist , a paediatrician and a social worker submitted their report on the physical and mental health of the applicant ’s daughter , finding that she was healthy but that her mother ’s insistence on a vegan diet posed a risk as regards her normal psychophysical development . The report was obtained at the request of the local social welfare centre in response to the applicant ’s allegations that ORG had been emotionally abusing their daughter and endangering her health by subjecting her to a vegan diet .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the first - instance decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and remitted the case . It again held that the first - instance decision had not been sufficiently reasoned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the first - instance decisions of DATE and CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) and remitted the case .

CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG State Attorney ’s Office ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u ORG ) indicted the applicant before ORG for the criminal offence of domestic violence allegedly committed against ORG in the period DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG acquitted the applicant . It found that he had not committed the acts of violence with which he had been charged . In its judgment that court also stated that the criminal proceedings against the applicant had been instrumental in the dispute over custody of his daughter and that ORG had used those proceedings in order to portray the applicant as a violent person and inadequate father , unworthy of that role , and thus prevent him from maintaining contact with his daughter .
CARDINAL . Following an appeal by the ORG Attorney , on DATE ORG ( PERSON u GPE ) , quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . It would appear that the proceedings are currently pending before ORG as the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . ORG convicted the applicant , on DATE , but the judgment was subsequently quashed by the second - instance court following his appeal and the case was remitted .
